== Main Inclusion Report for junitperf ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/j/junitperf]]</nowiki>; architecture: all
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of dom4
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=junitperf|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=junitperf|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: no records found
** Includes no binaries, only a java class.
** Network activity: does not open ports or handle any network data
** Does not process any binary data, or any input from an untrusted source as it is only used to provide profiling information on junit unit tests
** No source code review has been done.
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package is believed to work out-of-the-box in all cases. 
** No debconf questions asked.
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:junitperf|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: no open bugs
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/j/junitperf.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is dead
** <nowiki>[[http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html|Upstream]]</nowiki> is dormant
** No upstream bug tracker
** Hardware: package is not hardware-sensitive
** Upstream includes a test suite which is not enabled at build time because it has caused build failures in the past (Debian bug #396419).
0. ''UI standards:''
** This package is used only as a build-dependency of other libraries and should not interact with users at any point.
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance: yes
** Packaging system: cdbs
** Patch system: cdbs simple-patchsys
0. ''Dependencies:''
** java-gcj-compat | java1-runtime | java2-runtime
** junit
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Package is not expected to require significant ongoing maintenance. 
** The package will not be actively monitored by Ubuntu developers, and we will rely primarily on the Debian maintainer to provide bugfixes. The package is currently in sync with Debian.
